meanings.definition: The act or practice of containing or controlling the spread of biological agents or substances.
meanings.sent1: Biocontainment is crucial in preventing the spread of dangerous viruses.
meanings.sent2: Scientists work in biocontainment labs to study infectious diseases safely.
meanings.sent3: The biocontainment measures at the lab were so strict, even the bacteria had to wear tiny hazmat suits.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous biocontainment of information ensured that no secrets leaked out.
meanings.sent5: The biocontainment procedures were like a fortress, keeping the pathogens locked away.

meanings.definition: A facility or area designed to prevent the release of harmful biological materials.
meanings.sent1: The biocontainment facility was equipped with airlocks to maintain a sterile environment.
meanings.sent2: Biocontainment units are essential for handling deadly viruses safely.
meanings.sent3: The biocontainment room was so secure, even a fly couldn't escape.
meanings.sent4: The biocontainment area acted like a shield, protecting the outside world from dangerous pathogens.
meanings.sent5: Entering the biocontainment zone felt like stepping into a different world, isolated from all harm.
